intro: Critoniopsis choquetangensis, commonly known as the Choquetango mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is native to the arid regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white, fleshy berries that are a food source for various bird species. It attaches to its host trees through haustoria, drawing water and nutrients from the host. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
